content.webTitle: New ways to measure state output

fields.headline: New ways to measure state output
fields.bodyText: The Office for National Statistics has revised the measurements of public sector output for the last nine years, using methods recommended in the so-called Atkinson review this year. Gross domestic product was barely changed by the new methodology, said the ONS, but government output for 1996 to 2003 was a cumulative 0.5% higher. The ONS has broadened the way it measures health sector output by increasing the categories of treatment. School output is assessed using pupil attendance, rather than registration. The review by economist Sir Tony Atkinson made 54 recommendations about improving the way output of public services is measured. Shadow chancellor George Osborne said the ONS was not sufficiently independent. "Asking the government to judge its own performance is like a child being asked to write its own school report."
